citeinfo.origin: United States Department of Agriculture, National Agricultural Statistics Service, Research and Development Division, Geospatial Information Branch, Area Frame Section
citeinfo.title: CULTIVATED_AREAS_USDA_IN: Cultivated Areas in Indiana in 2004 (United States Department of Agriculture, 1:100,000, Polygon Shapefile)

pubinfo.publish: U.S. Department of Agriculture, National Agricultural Statistics Service

citeinfo.othercit: This layer is exactly the same as a shapefile named "strata_a_in.shp" and titled "Stratification of Indiana 2004" that was acquired by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey from the USDA. The shapefile was renamed and the title was changed in order to conform to metadata standards of the Indiana Geological Survey.

descript.abstract: The United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS) area sampling frame is a delineation of all parcels of land for the purpose of later sampling the parcels. The area frame is constructed by visually interpreting satellite imagery to divide a state into homogenous land use areas (strata) based on percent cultivated. The strata are typically defined as low, medium, or high percent cultivated, nonagricultural land, urban use, agri-urban, or water. The boundaries of the strata usually follow identifiable features such as roads, railroads, and waterways. The strata boundaries do not coincide with any political boundaries, with the exception of state boundaries.
descript.purpose: These data are intended for geographic display and analysis at the state level. The data should be displayed and analyzed at a scale of 1:100,000 or smaller (for example, 1:250,000, and so on). The strata data are provided "as is." USDA/NASS does not warrant results you may obtain using the strata data.

theme.themekt: ISO 19115 Topic Category - farming, 001. ISO 19115 Topic Category - environment, 007. National Agricultural Statistics Service, U.S. Department of Agriculture, 1987, Area Frame Design for Agricultural Surveys, Washington, D.C., NASS/USDA.

place.placekt: U.S. Department of Commerce, 1987, Codes for the Identification of the States, the District of Columbia and the Outlying Areas of The United States, and Associated Areas (Federal Information Processing Standard 5-2): Washington, D.C., National Institute of Standards and Technology.

idinfo.native: Environmental Systems Research Institute ArcView 3.3 shapefile, Microsoft Windows XP.

metadata.dataqual:
Checks for topological consistency were performed on this data set.
There are no known gaps or missing data. This data set includes the area in square miles and number of acres for each strata. Boundaries may not be coincident with strata boundaries of adjacent states.
The sources used for digitizing strata boundaries are 1:100,000-scale digital raster graphics of USGS topographic quadrangles

The area sampling frame for Indiana was constructed for use in 1989 and was based on USGS 1:100,000-scale topographic maps, 1:250,000-scale
digital Landsat imagery, and 1:100,000-scale SureMaps. The boundaries were modified in 2004 to conform to USGS 1:100,000 scale topographic digital raster graphics and digital line graph files. Individual county files were merged into single state file. The coordinates for the strata polygons are projected to UTM Zone 16, WGS 1984 datum (meters). The spatial data file format is Environmental Systems Research Institute's ArcView shapefile format. The shapefile was checked and edited for topology in 2004. Gaps and overlaps were corrected within an ESRI personal geodatabase. TopoQuad100Landsat5TIGERSuremapsSegCenterMapsDeLormeAtlasStateAgStatsLandsat72004 Personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey acquired the shapefile named "Stratification of Indiana 2004" from the NASS (National Agricultural Statistical Service, USDA). In order to
conform to naming and metadata conventions of the Indiana Geological Survey, the shapefile was re-named and the metadata were modified accordingly. Also, within the metadata, definitions were changed for two fields for which the definitions in the USDA metadata did not agree with values that appear in the USDA shapefile: (1) For Enumerated_Domain_Value = 31, the definition in the metadata was changed from ">20 Home/Square Mile" to ">100 Home/Square Mile," and (2) For Enumerated_Domain_Value = 32, the definition in the metadata was changed from ">20 Home/Square Mile" to ">100 Home/Square Mile." attr.attrdef: Land-use category based on percent cultivated
attr.attrdefs: U.S. Department of Agriculture, National Agricultural Statistics Service

edom.edomvd: > 75% cultivated, (cultivated categories consist of land used for crops, the remaining portion of land in the cultivated strata may include pasture, woods, waste, rangeland, etc.)
edom.edomvds: "2004 Area Frame Design Information, Implementation Years of Current NASS Area Frames," NASS Area Frame Section, March 2004.

edom.edomvd: 51%-75% cultivated, (cultivated categories consist of land used for crops, the remaining portion of land in the cultivated strata may include pasture, woods, waste, rangeland, etc.)
edom.edomvds: "2004 Area Frame Design Information, Implementation Years of Current NASS Area Frames," NASS Area Frame Section, March 2004.

edom.edomvd: 15%-50% Cultivated, (cultivated categories consist of land used for crops, the remaining portion of land in the cultivated strata may include pasture, woods, waste, rangeland, etc.)

distinfo.distliab: Users of the strata data are solely responsible for interpretations made from the product. The strata data are provided "as is." USDA/NASS does not warrant results you may obtain by using the strata data. Feel free to contact our staff at (HQ_RD_OD@nass.usda.gov) if technical questions arise in the use of the strata data.

stdorder.fees: There is no charge for the online option.

distinfo.distliab:
CREDIT
It is requested that the National Agricultural Statistics Service (NASS), United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), be cited in any products generated from this data set. The following source citation should be included: CULTIVATED_AREAS_USDA_IN: Cultivated Areas in Indiana in 2004 (United States Department of Agriculture, 1:100,000, Polygon Shapefile).
WARRANTY
Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey warrants that the media on which this product is stored will be free from defect in materials and workmanship for ninety (90) days from the date of acquisition. If such a defect is found, return the media to Publication Sales, Indiana Geological Survey, 611 North Walnut Grove, Bloomington, Indiana 47405-2208, and it will be replaced free of charge.
LIMITATION OF WARRANTIES AND LIABILITY
Except for the expressed warranty above, the product is provided "AS IS", without any other warranties or conditions, expressed or implied, including, but not limited to, warranties for product quality, or suitability to a particular purpose or use. The risk or liability resulting from the use of this product is assumed by the user. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey shares no liability with product users indirect, incidental, special, or consequential damages whatsoever, including, but not limited to, loss of revenue or profit, lost or damaged data or other commercial or economic loss. Indiana University, Indiana Geological Survey is not responsible for claims by a third party. The maximum aggregate liability to the original purchaser shall not exceed the amount paid by you for the product.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
